suggestions.policy_name: c-0002 - mitre - exec into container
suggestions.suggestion: It is recommended to prohibit “kubectl exec” command in production environments. It is also recommended not to use subjects with this permission for daily cluster operations.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0007 - mitre - data destruction
suggestions.suggestion: You should follow the least privilege principle and minimize the number of subjects that can delete resources.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0012 - mitre - applications credentials in configuration files
suggestions.suggestion: Use Kubernetes secrets or Key Management Systems to store credentials.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0014 - mitre - access kubernetes dashboard
suggestions.suggestion: Make sure that the “Kubernetes Dashboard” service account is only bound to the Kubernetes dashboard following the least privilege principle.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0015 - mitre - list kubernetes secrets
suggestions.suggestion: Monitor and approve list of users, groups and service accounts that can access secrets. Use exception mechanism to prevent repetitive the notifications.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0020 - mitre - mount service principal
suggestions.suggestion: Refrain from using path mount to known cloud credentials folders or files.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0021 - mitre - exposed sensitive interfaces
suggestions.suggestion: Consider blocking external interfaces or protect them with appropriate security tools.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0026 - mitre - kubernetes cronjob
suggestions.suggestion: Watch Kubernetes CronJobs and make sure they are legitimate.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0031 - mitre - delete kubernetes events
suggestions.suggestion: You should follow the least privilege principle. Minimize the number of subjects who can delete Kubernetes events. Avoid using these subjects in the daily operations.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0035 - mitre - cluster-admin binding
suggestions.suggestion: You should apply least privilege principle. Make sure cluster admin permissions are granted only when it is absolutely necessary. Dont use subjects with such high permissions for daily operations.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0036 - mitre - validate validating admission controller
suggestions.suggestion: Ensure all the webhooks are necessary. Use exception mechanism to prevent repititive notifications.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0037 - mitre - coredns poisoning
suggestions.suggestion: You should follow the least privilege principle. Monitor and approve all the subjects allowed to modify the coredns configmap. It is also recommended to remove this permission from the users/service accounts used in the daily operations.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0039 - mitre - validate mutating admission controller
suggestions.suggestion: Ensure all the webhooks are necessary. Use exception mechanism to prevent repititive notifications

suggestions.policy_name: c-0042 - mitre - ssh server running inside container
suggestions.suggestion: Remove SSH from the container image or limit the access to the SSH server using network policies.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0045 - mitre - writable hostpath mount
suggestions.suggestion: Refrain from using the hostPath mount or use the exception mechanism to remove unnecessary notifications.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0048 - mitre - hostpath mount
suggestions.suggestion: Remove hostPath mounts unless they are absolutely necessary and use exception mechanism to remove notifications.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0052 - mitre - instance metadata api
suggestions.suggestion: Disable metadata services for pods in cloud provider settings.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0053 - mitre - access container service account
suggestions.suggestion: Verify that RBAC is enabled. Follow the least privilege principle and ensure that only necessary pods have SA token mounted into them.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0054 - mitre - cluster internal networking
suggestions.suggestion: Define Kubernetes network policies or use alternative products to protect cluster network.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0057 - mitre - privileged container
suggestions.suggestion: Remove privileged capabilities by setting the securityContext.privileged to false. If you must deploy a Pod as privileged, add other restriction to it, such as network policy, Seccomp etc and still remove all unnecessary capabilities. Use the exception mechanism to remove unnecessary notifications.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0058 - mitre - cve-2021-25741 - using symlink for arbitrary host file system access
suggestions.suggestion: To mitigate this vulnerability without upgrading kubelet, you can disable the VolumeSubpath feature gate on kubelet and kube-apiserver, or remove any existing Pods using subPath or subPathExpr feature.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0059 - mitre - cve-2021-25742-nginx-ingress-snippet-annotation-vulnerability
suggestions.suggestion: To mitigate this vulnerability: 1. Upgrade to a version that allows mitigation (>

suggestions.policy_name: c-0066 - mitre - secret/etcd encryption enabled
suggestions.suggestion: Turn on the etcd encryption in your cluster, for more see the vendor documentation.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0067 - mitre - audit logs enabled
suggestions.suggestion: Turn on audit logging for your cluster. Look at the vendor guidelines for more details.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0068 - mitre - psp enabled
suggestions.suggestion: Turn Pod Security Policies on in your cluster, if you use other admission controllers to control the behavior that PSP controls, exclude this control from your scans.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0069 - mitre - disable anonymous access to kubelet service
suggestions.suggestion: Start the kubelet with the --anonymous-auth

suggestions.policy_name: c-0070 - mitre - enforce kubelet client tls authentication
suggestions.suggestion: Start the kubelet with the --client-ca-file flag, providing a CA bundle to verify client certificates with.

suggestions.policy_name: c-0070 - mitre - enforce kubelet client tls authentication
suggestions.suggestion: Start the kubelet with the --client-ca-file flag, providing a CA bundle to verify client certificates with.
